page.title: 11A LONGSTANTON SCHOOLDAY
page.content: My day starts by getting ready for school. I have a small breakfast of cereal, and then leave for school. School begins with a short service in the Hall for the older children. We meet for a hymn and a short prayer. Then we do some work in our classroom with our own teacher, in the mornings usually maths and language work. At noon we have a long break, and I have a school dinner. The afternoon begins with some music to listen to, and a poem, and then we do some Project or general interest work. Often we finish with our class story or with a time when we can read to ourselves.At 3.30 we all go home. I then get changed and play with my friends. After tea I play out again, or perhaps watch television.I go to bed at about eight o'clock. {(Paul Summersell, aged 10)
